publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7803 Annabel Goldie: Phil Gallie—That the Parliament notes with sorrow the death of Phil Gallie on 24 January 2011; pays tribute to his long and distinguished career in politics as a member of the Scottish Conservative and Unionist Party and, in particular, his time as a Member of Parliament from 1992 to 1997 and a Member of the Scottish Parliament from 1999 to 2007; recalls with affection his individual style of political debate and robust contributions to the work of this Parliament in committee and in the chamber; considers that he gave tireless service to his constituents in Ayr and the South of Scotland and commends him for it, and expresses the condolences of the Parliament to his family.

S3M-7803 Phil Gallie (lodged on 26 January 2011) George Foulkes*, Andrew Welsh*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Jamie Hepburn*, Bill Butler*, Karen Gillon*, Derek Brownlee*, Andy Kerr*, Jackson Carlaw*, Jim Tolson*, Elaine Smith*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Mike Rumbles*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Robert Brown*, Jackie Baillie*, Gavin Brown*, Rob Gibson*, Michael McMahon*, Stewart Stevenson*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Margaret Mitchell*, Jamie McGrigor*, John Lamont*, Ross Finnie*, Tricia Marwick*, Robin Harper*, Irene Oldfather*, Bill Kidd*, Michael Matheson*, Ted Brocklebank*, Duncan McNeil*, Jack McConnell*, Alasdair Allan*, Sandra White*, Patricia Ferguson*, Murdo Fraser*, Willie Coffey*, John Park*, Mary Scanlon*, Stewart Maxwell*, Cathy Jamieson*, Des McNulty*, Ian McKee*, Kenneth Gibson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Margaret Curran*, Jamie Stone*, David Stewart*, Iain Smith*, Bob Doris*, David McLetchie*, Nanette Milne*, Bill Aitken*, Pauline McNeill*, Elizabeth Smith*, Brian Adam*, Alex Johnstone*, Mike Pringle*, James Kelly*, Gil Paterson*
